testimonialsSection.subtitle: Discover the inspiring stories of those who found their place in Quebec

items.name: Asma B.
items.text: Thanks to CARI, I found my dream job in 6 months! The personalized support and workshops gave me the confidence I needed to succeed in my interviews.

items.name: Jean-Pierre H.
items.text: From refugee to entrepreneur, CARI supported me at every step. Today, I have my own business and employ 5 people.

items.name: Jasmine M.
items.text: French seemed impossible, now I speak it fluently! The courses are excellent and the teachers very patient.

items.name: Karla A.
items.text: My children are thriving, we found our place here. CARI's family services made all the difference.

items.name: Wei L.
items.text: The help understanding the Quebec system changed everything. I now feel at home in Montreal.

parallaxItems.quote: Welcoming, listening, guiding — that's our daily mission.
parallaxItems.name: Nadia R.

parallaxItems.quote: Every resume we improve together opens a new door.
parallaxItems.name: Marco T.

parallaxItems.quote: Teaching French means giving the keys to a new life.
parallaxItems.name: Sylvie D.

welcome.title: Welcome & Integration
welcome.description: Information, orientation and personalized support to facilitate your settlement.
welcome.fullDescription: Our welcome and integration service supports immigrants through professional counsellors offering comprehensive assistance for personal and professional integration.
welcome.details: Free service offered in French, English, Spanish, Arabic and other languages. In-person or phone appointments.

items.name: Settlement and integration assistance
items.description: Support for RAMQ card, SIN, daycare registration, school enrollment and settlement procedures.

items.name: Administrative forms assistance
items.description: Family allowances, sponsorship applications, citizenship forms, work permit renewals.

items.name: Housing search
items.description: Support in finding housing and understanding tenant/landlord rights.

items.name: Sworn declarations
items.description: Solemn declarations, invitation letters, travel authorizations, powers of attorney and certified copies. First 15 copies free for immigrants in Canada less than 5 years.

items.name: Legal clinic
items.description: Free legal information on housing, immigration, family law through our Pro Bono and Droit Légal partners.

items.name: Tax returns
items.description: Annual tax return assistance through our tax clinic.

items.name: Information and referral
items.description: Professional needs assessment and referral to appropriate community resources.

items.name: Intercultural mediation and interpretation
items.description: Help understanding government communications and navigating social systems.

items.name: Personalized follow-up and psychosocial support
items.description: Confidential support and emotional guidance throughout the integration journey.

items.name: Information sessions
items.description: Workshops on tenant rights, budget management, Quebec school system, taxes and winter preparation.

items.name: Men's Space Committee
items.description: Specialized psychosocial support, personalized guidance and referrals to resources for immigrant men.

items.name: Family vacation camp
items.description: Cottage stays by a lake near Montreal for families, in an intercultural setting.

items.name: Family outings
items.description: Cultural and discovery activities: Quebec City, Montmorency Falls, Granby Zoo, Botanical Garden, Biodome, apple picking, sugar shacks.

french.title: French Learning
french.description: French courses adapted for immigrants, all levels, flexible schedules (8:30 AM-10 PM). Test your level for free!
french.fullDescription: French is the official and common language of Quebec. CARI offers free government-funded French courses, full-time and part-time, from beginner to advanced level.
benefits: Flexible schedules from 8:30 AM to 10 PM
french.details: Free courses funded by MIFI. Possibility of participation allowance. Continuous enrollment.

sections.title: Full-time Courses
sections.description: Intensive 25-hour per week program for people with limited schooling. 20 hours in class with a teacher and 5 hours with a facilitator. 11-week sessions, 4 sessions per year.

sections.title: Part-time Courses
sections.description: Program for literate immigrants (minimum 9 years of schooling). Offered through the Programme d'intégration linguistique des immigrants (PILI).

items.name: Morning: 9:00 AM-12:00 PM
items.description: 9 to 12 hours per week

items.name: Afternoon: 12:30-3:30 PM
items.description: 9 to 12 hours per week

items.name: Evening: 6:30-9:30 PM
items.description: 6 to 9 hours per week

items.name: Neighbourhood outings
items.description: Visits to libraries, museums, recreation centres, grocery stores and thrift shops.

items.name: Rallies and tours
items.description: Discovery of the Old Port and neighbourhood exploration.

sections.title: Childcare
sections.description: Childcare available for children aged 0 to 5, fully reimbursed by MIFI.

employment.title: Employment Assistance
employment.description: Resume workshops, interview simulations, professional coaching and meetings with employers.
employment.fullDescription: Finding a job is essential to successful integration! Our department supports immigrants' integration into the job market through personalized guidance and group activities.
benefits: Resume and cover letter writing workshops
employment.details: Free service with personalized follow-up. Individual appointments and regular group workshops.

items.name: Job placement
items.description: Partnerships with Quebec companies for job and internship placements.

items.name: Contact network
items.description: Professional networking and meetings with employers.

items.name: Resume writing
items.description: Help writing a resume adapted to the Quebec job market.

items.name: Job search workshops
items.description: 8 workshops per year, 5-week sessions (9 AM-4 PM), approximately 15 participants. Job search methods and tools.

items.name: Skills from abroad
items.description: Skills assessment, search strategies, communication, networking, experience in a Quebec workplace.

items.name: Personalized support
items.description: Individual guidance: resumes, cover letters, interview preparation, job market orientation, employer referrals.

items.name: Interview preparation
items.description: Interview simulations and personalized coaching.

items.name: Job postings
items.description: Access to a diverse pool of qualified immigrant candidates.

items.name: Candidate pre-selection
items.description: Selection from our talent pool across multiple sectors.

items.name: Available profiles
items.description: Administration, accounting, IT, engineering, telecommunications, food service, legal, environment.

items.name: Job retention follow-up
items.description: Support for employers integrating diversity in the workplace.

items.name: Financial assistance
items.description: Guidance to access government wage subsidy programs.

items.name: Employer meetings
items.description: Monthly networking events between employers and job seekers.

items.name: Laurentian Employment Rendez-vous
items.description: Annual event connecting employers with over 100 job seekers.

family.title: Parents & Youth
family.description: Support for families, activities for children and teenagers, help with schooling.
family.fullDescription: Our department supports immigrant families in understanding the Quebec school system, offers psychological support, childcare services and contributes to children's development and academic success.
family.details: Free or low-cost services. Limited spots, registration required.

items.name: School system guidance
items.description: Support and orientation for immigrant families navigating the Quebec school system, facilitating communication between school and family.

items.name: Childhood-Family Clinic
items.description: Free and confidential service where families can discuss child-related challenges with specialized staff, in a safe and professional environment.

items.name: Parent Space workshops
items.description: 9 workshops helping parents understand their role in their children's academic success and navigate the school system.

items.name: Parent support groups
items.description: Strengthening parenting skills with the 'Nobody's Perfect' program: behaviour, development, safety and parenting role.

items.name: Growing in community childcare
items.description: Educational program offering physical, play-based and educational activities for children.

items.name: Low-cost summer camps
items.description: Summer camps for elementary-age children from low-income immigrant families, with French practice.

items.name: March break camp
items.description: Camp programming during the school March break.

items.name: Healthy lunches
items.description: Monthly Tuesday lunch programs to learn healthy eating habits through collective cooking, in collaboration with Women of the World.

sections.title: Childcare
sections.description: Childcare available for parents participating in activities, including asylum seekers. Call for availability.

women.title: Women of the World
women.description: Specific programs for immigrant women: autonomy, health, employment.
women.fullDescription: Through conversation and diverse activities, we offer women spaces for a better understanding of the host society and themselves. Skills development, networking, volunteering and civic participation.
women.details: Free and confidential. Welcoming and supportive group. Childcare available on request.

items.name: Sewing and crafts
items.description: Creative workshops in a welcoming environment: machine sewing, fabric cutting, clothing alterations and repairs.

items.name: Health and international cooking
items.description: Learning healthy eating habits with Quebec products and discovering traditional dishes from different countries.

items.name: French practice
items.description: Improving oral comprehension and communication through practical application of French courses.

items.name: Public speaking and professional portfolio
items.description: Developing professional autonomy, decision-making, goal-setting and self-promotion techniques.

items.name: Civic participation
items.description: Workshops on Quebec society, women's conditions, rights awareness and social engagement.

items.name: Discussion cafes
items.description: Informal gatherings for immigrant women sharing their experiences in Quebec society.

items.name: Yoga
items.description: Fitness and stress management sessions.

items.name: Family outings
items.description: Organized excursions in partnership with the welcome and integration service.

items.name: Living libraries
items.description: Personal testimonies on diversity, racism, human rights and gender equality to counter stereotypes.

items.name: Book club and life stories
items.description: Reading discussions combined with collaborative writing projects capturing personal narratives.

items.name: Eco Sewing
items.description: Educational workshops on the impacts of the textile industry and eco-creative alternatives.

items.name: Women's Place
items.description: Awareness workshops on socio-ecological impacts of the textile industry and sustainable alternatives.

items.name: Psychosocial support
items.description: Personalized and confidential guidance to address the specific needs and challenges of immigrant women.

contactInfo.note: Mon-Fri 8:30 AM-5:00 PM · Free and confidential

volunteering.title: Training & Community Life
volunteering.description: Intercultural meetings, social activities and volunteering opportunities.
volunteering.fullDescription: Helping newcomers develop civic engagement and get involved in their host society through training and group activities. Building autonomy, skills and networking.
volunteering.details: Free. Flexible commitment based on your availability. Volunteering certificates available.

items.name: English courses
items.description: Intermediate and advanced levels for permanent residents and Canadian citizens who speak French. Grammar, writing, reading, comprehension and conversation.

items.name: Computer courses
items.description: 6-week sessions: Word, Excel, PowerPoint at beginner, intermediate and advanced levels.

items.name: English conversation
items.description: Communication and pronunciation workshops for all levels.

items.name: Communicate and participate
items.description: 6 workshops on oral communication, public speaking and civic engagement for French speakers.

items.name: Citizenship exam preparation
items.description: Tools and resources to prepare for the Canadian citizenship exam.

items.name: The ABCs of my integration
items.description: 4 workshops covering daily, active, academic and social integration.

items.name: Connected Days
items.description: Workshops on technology tools and the web for daily life.

items.name: Cyber-government
items.description: Introduction to online government services and available benefits.

items.name: Network Space
items.description: Networking development and social media skills workshops (Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram).

items.name: EPVC Thursdays
items.description: Bi-monthly workshops with two tracks: Eco-citizen (environment, zero waste, gardening) and Getting to know Quebec (history, cuisine, expressions, folklore).

items.name: Civic participation
items.description: Public consultations, civic engagement spaces for 18-35 year olds, information sessions on volunteering.

items.name: Socio-cultural activities
items.description: Museum and theatre outings, film discussions, intercultural celebrations, creative projects including engaged theatre and writing marathons.

items.name: Integration through outdoor activities
items.description: Outdoor activities and local sports to promote integration.

items.name: Language pairing
items.description: Language exchange program to practise French with volunteers.

items.name: Intercultural pairing
items.description: Social and linguistic bridge between newcomers and Quebecers.

items.name: Artistic pairing
items.description: Artistic collaboration between Quebec and immigrant artists for collective exhibitions.

sections.title: Volunteering
sections.description: Get involved! Volunteering opportunities: administrative work, event hosting, workshop co-facilitation, interpretation, childcare support and session organizing.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.statement: Welcome, help and accompany immigrants in their personal, social and professional integration.
mission.vision: Serve and unite through innovative expertise and practices for a better life together.
mission.historyIntro: Created in 1989, the Centre d'Accueil et de Référence sociale et économique pour Immigrants de Saint-Laurent (CARI St-Laurent) is a non-profit, non-denominational and non-partisan organization.
mission.approach: An intercultural approach based on respect for difference, openness to others and ethnocultural and religious diversity.
mission.impact: Over 7,000 people supported each year, from 128 countries and speaking 95 different languages.
